In some cases, I think the AI did not understand the human subtleties of a situation.

Q821:
I don't hold strong opinions about my partner for this task, as we barely got to speak. She wants to do a good job in completing this survey just I do, so I know we have that in common for sure.

I did notice we were typically holding opposite viewpoints for the questions, but it is hard to discuss the nuance of the choices I selected without a way to send messages during the questioning process. I just had to go with my gut feeling on these questions.

Q821:
It would be nice to see "why" the AI chose its answer. 

When I ask for information or advice, I ask for reasoning to determine if I will go with their input or mine. If I'm asking for help on something like a form or an operational requirement, I ask why they need it. 

"Why" helps my final decision. :)

Q821: My AI partner demonstrates impressive efficiency in processing data and identifying patterns, but it lacks the ability to fully comprehend the nuances of human emotion and complex interpersonal dynamics. While it excels in tasks that are logical and repetitive, it cannot match the creative problem-solving abilities and contextual understanding of humans. For research teams, AI is a valuable tool but should be used alongside human expertise to complement each other.
